description: From Old French celestin, Latin caelestīnus, from caelestis (“heavenly”) + -inus (“-ine”), from caelum (“sky, heavens, Heaven”). Equivalent to celest +‎ -ine.

adjectives.description: celestine (comparative more celestine, superlative most celestine)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Synonym of celestial: of or resembling the heavens.
(obsolete) A heavenly being: an angel or other resident of Heaven.

description: From Italian celestina (“sky-blue”), from Latin caelestīnus, &c.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A mineral with orthorhombic crystals, SrSO4, colourless or white with blue and sometimes red shades.
